There is the point of Sony's involvement in this. The were the muscle behind the advertising. I understand that a class action lawsuit would be the way to go, but it really isn't about the money. Companies need to know that we the consumers hold them accountable for what they advertise and hopefully that the government will back us up on that.

WRITING.TITLE: Is there legal ramifications for Sean Murry's lies?
WRITING.TEXT: We know he lied about the product and concealed the truth about the game being single player. Isn't that called false advertising? Don't we as consumers have a legal course of action we can take?

WRITING.TITLE: Is there legal ramifications for the lies of Sean Murry?
WRITING.TEXT: We know for a fact he lied about a product and concealed the truth about the game being single player. Isn't that called false advertising and do we not have a legal recourse as consumers?
What Sean did is called false advertising. There is a law against that.

WRITING.TITLE: After Getting My Atlas V3 Pass
WRITING.TEXT:
So after getting my atlas v3 pass I went crazy opening every door I could find. I went to every planet on every system and every space station in those systems for three hours and here is what I found.
Jack shit. Most of the time it's bigger fauna rooms or just resource cashes that are a joke. After all that time of trying to get one and recieving it all I find is crap. Of anyone else out there has one and had found something cool please tell me what you found. This is sadning for me.

I pre-ordered this game for the pc. I still have two more days till I get to play it. With that said, I'm still hyped to play it. This has been the most anticipated game (for me) for the last two years. Just two more days...
